author: ETA PRIME
description:
Recently Valve announced their upcoming Steam Machine, and on paper it looks REALLY exciting… but it doesn’t release until January 2026. So instead of waiting two years, I decided to build my own Steam Machine using a small form factor gaming PC with a discrete Radeon GPU — and the results surprised me!
For this build I picked up a FORUM MX100G on eBay for under $500. It was missing a few parts (including the PSU), but the compact design, the Ryzen 7 7840HS, and the Radeon RX 6650M made it a perfect candidate for a DIY SteamOS console. And yes — I installed SteamOS 3.9 using the Steam Deck recovery image… and EVERYTHING works!
In this video I benchmark Cyberpunk 2077, Spider-Man 2, Elden Ring, Borderlands 4, and more to see how close this thing gets to the specs Valve announced for their upcoming Steam Machine: a custom Zen 4 CPU and an RDNA3-based 28CU GPU. Honestly? This little DIY unit might be closer than people think.
If Valve can work magic with Proton and their custom drivers l
title: The Steam Machine Isn’t Out Yet… So I Built My OWN!
